hypothesis_content.title: Intra-Regime Micro-Breakout Fade in STRESS or BEAR Markets
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS or BEAR market regimes, a sharp intraday price breakout (e.g., >3% move in under 2 hours) that occurs on low relative volume (vs. 1-hour average) and pushes price into overbought territory (RSI(4h) > 75) will fail and revert strongly, providing a high-probability short-term mean reversion opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In weak regimes, strong moves缺乏 sustained buying pressure (low volume) are often liquidity grabs or short squeezes, not fundamental shifts. Overbought conditions in a bearish context are quickly sold into by algorithmic and institutional sellers.
entry_conditions: Market Regime is STRESS or BEAR.
BTC price rallies >3% within a 2-hour candle.
Volume during the 2-hour breakout candle is < 0.8x the average volume of the prior 10 two-hour candles.
4-hour RSI crosses above 75 during or immediately after the move.
Price reaches a local resistance level (e.g., prior 4-hour high, VWAP).

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial breakout move.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes above the high of the breakout candle (confirmation of strength, not weakness).

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Low-volume breakouts in bear markets sustain and continue upwards more than 40% of the time, indicating they are genuine shifts in sentiment rather than traps.
